content.title: Build first x402 paywalled service

content.body:
## Context
Built a PepePaint browser painting system where Kaleido paints live in Pepe Paint (MS Paint clone).
Full pipeline: Prompt → Spark (ComfyUI) → PepePaint Engine → Browser CDP → Export

## Current State
- Pipeline works end-to-end (forge_pepepaint.py)
- All tools functional: brush, pencil, airbrush, line, rectangle, ellipse
- Undo disabled to prevent memory crash
- ~670 commands, 28 seconds for painting phase

## Problem
Strokes are too abstract/chaotic — colors come from reference but shapes are random.

## TODO
1. Edge-following strokes — detect contours in reference, have strokes follow them
2. Composition awareness — paint background→midground→foreground
3. Region-based color blocking — identify major color regions, fill with overlapping strokes
4. Gradient sampling — along-stroke color changes following the reference gradient
5. Reduce stroke randomness — bias stroke direction toward image structure (Sobel/gradient flow)
6. Full pipeline test — Spark → PepePaint with a good prompt, export final piece
7. ComfyUI IPAdapter speed — investigate why it took 30+ min (normally 5-6 min)

## Files
- agents/kaleido/scripts/forge_pepepaint.py — main pipeline
- agents/kaleido/scripts/pepepaint_engine.py — command generator (needs improvement)
- agents/kaleido/scripts/pepepaint_bridge.js — JS bridge for browser
- agents/kaleido/scripts/pepepaint_run.py — batch helper
content.title: PepePaint: Improve stroke quality + full pipeline run
